name: Aarushi Goel
content: Aarushi Goel Aarushi Goel Office: Hill Center 418 Email: aarushi [DOT] goel [AT] rutgers [DOT] edu About I am an Assistant Professor in the Computer Science department at Rutgers University. I am a member of the theory group at Rutgers. Prior to joining Rutgers, I was an Assistant Professor at Purdue University. Even before that, I was a postdoc at NTT Research, where I worked under the wonderful mentorship of Sanjam Garg. I received my PhD from Johns Hopkins University, where I was extremely fortunate to be advised by Abhishek Jain. I have a broad interest in cryptography and related areas of security. I am looking for motivated students to join me! If you are interested, please feel free to email me or stop by my office. Teaching CS65500: Advanced Cryptography (Spring 2025, Purdue University) CS59200-STC: Special Topics in Cryptography (Fall 2024, Purdue University) Service Program Committee: TCC 2023, TCC 2024, CRYPTO 2025, ACM CCS 2025, TCC 2025, Asiacrypt 2025, CSCML 2025, IEEE S&P 2026 Organizing: Midwest Security Workshop, RISE: Research Insights and Stories for Enlightenment Publications (Authors arranged alphabetically) Manuscripts PICS: Private Intersection over Committed (and reusable) Sets [eprint] Aarushi Goel, Peihan Miao, Phuoc Van Long Pham, Satvinder Singh 2026 Jigsaw: Doubly Private Smart Contracts [eprint] Sanjam Garg, Aarushi Goel, Dimitris Kolonelos, Rohit Sinha IEEE S&P 2026SBC 2025 2025 Multiparty Distributed Point Functions [eprint][slides (pptx)] Aarushi Goel, Mingyuan Wang, Zhiheng WangCRYPTO 2025 Malicious Security in Collaborative zkSNARKs: More than Meets the Eye [eprint][slides (pdf)] Sanjam Garg, Aarushi Goel, Abhishek Jain, Bhaskar Roberts, Sruthi Sekar CRYPTO 2025 Split Prover Zero-Knowledge SNARKs [eprint] Sanjam Garg, Aarushi Goel, Dimitris Kolonelos, Sina Shiehan, Rohit Sinha PKC 2025 2024 Homomorphic Secret Sharing with Verifiable Evaluation [eprint][slides (pdf)] Arka Rai Choudhuri, Aarushi Goel, Aditya Hegde, Abhishek Jain TCC 2024 Dora: A Simple Approach to Zero-Knowledge for RAM Programs [eprint][slides (pdf)] Aarushi Goel, Mathias Hall-Andersen, Gabriel KaptchukACM CCS 2024 How to Prove Statements Obliviously?
